name: GetAvailableCountriesForMinimumWages
description:
Retrieve a list of countries for minimum wage queries.

This tool retrieves a list of countries that can be used as query parameters in the minimum wage rates endpoint. Use this to determine which countries are available for checking minimum wage rates.

parameters.name: country_workday_id
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the country for tax authorities, used in queries for minimum wage rates.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the country for the tax authorities. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/countries. You can specify 1 country query parameter. Example: country=country.

parameters.name: response_limit
parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of countries returned in a single response. Accepts an integer up to 1000.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: response_offset_index
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. Default is 0. Use with 'limit' to control paging.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: include_local_tax_authorities
parameters.description: Set to true to include local tax authorities (cities and counties). Default is false for federal and state only.

value_schema.description: If true, returns local tax authorities, such as cities and counties, in addition to federal and state tax authorities. If false (default), only returns federal and state tax authorities.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Workday API

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the country for the tax authorities. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/countries. You can specify 1 country query parameter. Example: country=country.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the country for the tax authorities. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/countries. You can specify 1 country query parameter. Example: country=country.

parameters.name: includeLocalTaxAuthorities
parameters.description: If true, returns local tax authorities, such as cities and counties, in addition to federal and state tax authorities. If false (default), only returns federal and state tax authorities.

value_schema.description: If true, returns local tax authorities, such as cities and counties, in addition to federal and state tax authorities. If false (default), only returns federal and state tax authorities.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
